title: Shell Scripting Quiz
description: Quiz covering operating systems shell scripting.

questions.text: Which character is used to comment a single line in a bash script?
questions.explanation: The # character is used to comment a single line in a bash script.

questions.text: Which command is used to make a script executable in Linux?
questions.explanation: The chmod +x command is used to make a script executable in Linux.

questions.text: Shell scripts are compiled before execution.
questions.explanation: Shell scripts are interpreted, not compiled.

questions.text: Which command is used to print output to the console in a bash script?
questions.explanation: The echo command is used to print output to the console in a bash script.

questions.text: Which symbol is used to redirect standard output to a file in a bash script?
questions.explanation: The > symbol is used to redirect standard output to a file in a bash script.

questions.text: The '==' operator is used for string comparison in bash scripts.
questions.explanation: The '=' operator is used for string comparison in bash scripts.

questions.text: Which command is used to read user input in a bash script?
questions.explanation: The read command is used to read user input in a bash script.

questions.text: Which of the following is used to define a variable in a bash script?
questions.explanation: Variables are defined in bash scripts by assigning a value to a name (e.g., variable=value).

questions.text: Variables are referenced using the '$' symbol in bash scripts.
questions.explanation: Variables are referenced using the '$' symbol in bash scripts.

questions.text: Which command is used to create a directory in a bash script?
questions.explanation: The mkdir command is used to create a directory in a bash script.

questions.text: Which command is used to remove a file in a bash script?
questions.explanation: The rm command is used to remove a file in a bash script.

questions.text: The 'rmdir' command is used to remove a file in a bash script.
questions.explanation: The 'rmdir' command is used to remove an empty directory in a bash script, while 'rm' is used to remove a file.

questions.text: Which command is used to create an empty file in a bash script?
questions.explanation: The touch command is used to create an empty file in a bash script.

questions.text: Which command is used to display the first 10 lines of a file in a bash script?
questions.explanation: The head -n 10 command is used to display the first 10 lines of a file in a bash script.

questions.text: The 'cat' command is used to edit a file in a bash script.
questions.explanation: The 'cat' command is used to display the contents of a file, not edit it.

questions.text: Which command is used to find files based on a pattern in a bash script?
questions.explanation: The find command is used to find files based on a pattern in a bash script.

questions.text: Which command is used to display the last 10 lines of a file in a bash script?
questions.explanation: The tail -n 10 command is used to display the last 10 lines of a file in a bash script.

questions.text: The 'chmod' command is used to change file ownership in Linux.
questions.explanation: The 'chmod' command is used to change file permissions, not ownership. The 'chown' command is used to change file ownership.

questions.text: Which command is used to copy files in a bash script?
questions.explanation: The cp command is used to copy files in a bash script.

questions.text: Which command is used to move or rename files in a bash script?
questions.explanation: The mv command is used to move or rename files in a bash script.
